directions: Bring vegetable broth to just under boiling.

Heat 45 ml (3 tbsp) oil in a heavy-based pan; add the onion and leeks and cook over low heat until completely soft and translucent. Add 5 of the chopped garlic cloves; turn up heat and stir for 1 minute. Add the rice, stirring frequently until the grains are completely covered in oil and beginning to turn translucent.

Pour in the wine (it should steam and bubble). Season with salt. Gradually add hot stock a ladleful at a time until the liquid has been absorbed by the rice. Stir in the soy cream and pepper. Season to taste, then turn down heat.

In separate pan, warm oil over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and fry for 1 to 2 minutes until they have softened and coloured a little. Add to the risotto. Make a quick parsley oil combining parsley, remaining chopped garlic clove and as much oil as you like. Drizzle over the risotto and serve immediately.
ingredients: 435 ml (1 ¾ cups) Arborio or Carnaroli rice
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
title: Wild mushroom and leek risotto
